definition: to hang up (a picture etc)/to hoist up (a flag)/(computing) to suspend (a process)/(of a system) to hang/pending (operation)

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to feel unconcerned and let matters rest (idiom)
pinyin: shi4 bu4 guan1 ji3 , gao1 gao1 gua4 qi3

sentences.english: The white flag was run up;the post had surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 白旗高高挂起，驻军业已投降。

sentences.english: Not all files in the pending check-in are within the currently open solution.
sentences.chinese: 挂起签入中的某些文件不属于当前打开的解决方案。

sentences.english: There daily I wander as noon rises high.
sentences.chinese: 正午的骄阳高高挂起，那是我日常漫步的去处。

sentences.english: That program would, every so often, print a prompt, then hang up on you.
sentences.chinese: 这种程序会非常频繁地输出一个提示，然后挂起不动。

sentences.english: Is it yourself, high and hang up?
sentences.chinese: 是事不关己，高高挂起吗？

definition: to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
to raise one's head/to perk up
to float up/to rise to the surface/fig. to rise in the world
